title: Teaching
text: Below are the courses I have taught at UFLA in the last years.

title: Teaching
text:
Undergraduate Courses

GES139 • Organização e apresentação de dados
2024/01, 2024/02, 2025/01, 2026/01
The goal of this course is to provide students with the necessary tools to explore, visualize, and analyze data to better understand phenomena and investigate patterns. Key topics include data cleaning and wrangling, visualization, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA), and effective methods for communication and reproducibility. The course combines theoretical and practical sessions with hands-on projects, focusing on the use of open-source tools.
Target Audience: First-semester undergraduate students in Statistics at UFLA
Materials: Coming soon 


GES119 • Modelos Lineares I
2025/02
The objective of this course is to introduce the theory of linear models, focusing on full-rank models. It covers simple and multiple regression models, grounded in matrix algebra theory.
Target Audience: Fourth-semester undergraduate students in Statistics at UFLA.
Materials: Coming soon


GES101 • Estatística
2025/01, 2025/02, 2026/01
The goal of this course is to introduce Statistical Science, covering the core concepts of descriptive statistics, probability, and statistical inference.
Target Audience: Students from different undergraduate programs at UFLA.
Materials: Coming soon


GES107 • Estatística aplicada
2025/01
The objective of this course is to introduce Statistical Science, covering descriptive statistics and the fundamentals of statistical inference. The course focuses on presenting statistical methods and their practical applications across various fields.
Target Audience: Students from different undergraduate programs at UFLA.


GES106 • Introdução à Estatística
2024/02 • Graduação
The goal of this course is to provide a foundational overview of Statistics, covering basic descriptive and inferential methods.
Target Audience: Students from different undergraduate programs at UFLA.

title: Teaching
text:
Graduate Courses

PEX 801 • Recursos computacionais aplicados à Estatística e Experimentação Agropecuária
2024/01
The objective of this course is to provide an introduction to open-source computing resources, with a focus on exploratory data analysis (EDA). It covers the fundamental characteristics of key programming languages and essential packages for data manipulation and visualization.
Target Audience: Incoming Master’s students in the Graduate Program in Statistics and Agricultural Experimentation at UFLA.

title: Projects
text:
*Undergraduate students involved during the project’s execution.







Ciência de Dados e o pioneirismo feminino: uma trilha formativa com abordagem STEAM
(Data Science and Female Pioneering: A STEAM-Based Learning Path)
Ongoing
Funding: FAPEMIG (Call 013/2024)
Timeline: August 2025 - August 2028
Team: Izabela R. Cardoso de Oliveira (Coordinator), Sidney de Almeida Ferreira, Juliana Andrade Santiago, Gabriel Garcêz Bertolin, Luíza Helena Pereira Lúcio* e Maria Rita Oliveira Nogueira*
This project focuses on developing a Data Science learning path for secondary school students. Inspired by the legacy of Florence Nightingale, the initiative follows the integrated STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics) approach. The project involves collaborations with the Department of Medicine and two public schools.











ConectaStat: Ciência, Estatística e Conexão
(ConectaStat: Science, Statistics, and Connection)
Ongoing
Timeline: April 2025 - April 2027
Team: Izabela R. Cardoso de Oliveira (Coordinator), Luiz Otávio de Oliveira Pala, Luiz Ricardo Nakamura, João Domingos Scalon, Tales Jesus Fernandes, Camilla Marques Barroso, Pedro Mambelli Fernandes*
ConectaStat is a science communication project focused on the field of Statistics. The platform showcases academic and outreach initiatives, promotes statistical literacy, and bridges the gap between the university and society through accessible content. Our goal is to make Statistics more understandable and relevant to diverse audiences, encouraging the application of statistical thinking in daily life and decision-making.











O mercado de produtos para nutrição animal: modelagem e predição de preços
(The Animal Nutrition Market: Price Modeling and Prediction)
Completed
Funding: FAPEMIG (Call 017/2022)
Partner Company: JPA Agro e Serviços LTDA
Timeline: August 2023 - November 2025
Team: Izabela R. Cardoso de Oliveira (Coordinator), Thelma Sáfadi, Sérgio Domingos Simão, João Paulo Assis Bonifácio* e Heitor Rodrigues Sabino*
This research project is conducted in partnership with the private sector and is funded through a postdoctoral fellowship. The focus is on statistical modeling and price prediction for key inputs in the animal nutrition market, with the implementation of solutions via interactive dashboards to support corporate decision-making.

title: Izabela Regina Cardoso de Oliveira
text:
I am a Statistics educator and consultant. I have been a professor at Universidade Federal de Lavras (UFLA) since 2015, teaching at both undergraduate and graduate levels. Currently, I am a member of the Statistics Undergraduate Board and a collaborator in the Graduate Program in Statistics and Agricultural Experimentation.
My passion lies in teaching statistics with a computational focus, prioritizing the use of open-source tools and student-centered methods. My research is dedicated to applying statistical methods to solve real-world problems, and my scientific production is largely the result of interdisciplinary collaborations across various fields of knowledge.
Beyond the university, I work to increase female representation in STEM as a founding member of the R-Ladies and PyLadies chapters in Lavras. I also coordinate outreach projects that connect the university with the corporate sector and bring Data Science education to secondary school students.
To learn more about my background and publications, you can view my CV on the Lattes Platform (available in both Portuguese and English)

title: Izabela Regina Cardoso de Oliveira
text:
I am a Statistics educator and consultant. I have been a professor at Universidade Federal de Lavras (UFLA) since 2015, teaching at both undergraduate and graduate levels. Currently, I am a member of the Statistics Undergraduate Board and a collaborator in the Graduate Program in Statistics and Agricultural Experimentation.
My passion lies in teaching statistics with a computational focus, prioritizing the use of open-source tools and student-centered methods. My research is dedicated to applying statistical methods to solve real-world problems, and my scientific production is largely the result of interdisciplinary collaborations across various fields of knowledge.
Beyond the university, I work to increase female representation in STEM as a founding member of the R-Ladies and PyLadies chapters in Lavras. I also coordinate outreach projects that connect the university with the corporate sector and bring Data Science education to secondary school students.
To learn more about my background and publications, you can view my CV on the Lattes Platform (available in both Portuguese and English)
